verses.roman:
īśvara-purīra śiṣya--brahmacārī kāśīśvara
śrī-govinda nāma tāṅra priya anucara

synonyms: īśvara-purīra śiṣya—disciple of Īśvara Purī; brahmacārī kāśīśvara—of the name Brahmacārī Kāśīśvara; śrī-govinda—of the name Śrī Govinda; nāma—name; tāṅra—his; priya—very dear; anucara—follower.
translation: Brahmacārī Kāśīśvara was a disciple of Īśvara Purī, and Śrī Govinda was another of his dear disciples.

purport.content: Govinda was the personal servant of Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu. In the Gaura-gaṇoddeśa-dīpikā, verse 137, it is stated that the servants formerly named Bhṛṅgāra and Bhaṅgura in Vṛndāvana became Kāśīśvara and Govinda in Caitanya Mahāprabhu's pastimes. Govinda always engaged in the service of the Lord, even at great risk.
